Columbia is actively repatriating
lost or stolen National Artifacts from
abroad. This effort has
increased significantly since Mr. Gustavo Petro
was elected President of Columbia.  In
August
last year, at least 560 antiquities were
repatriated during
Mr. Petro's extensive foreign diplomatic trips during his 1
year in power. A total of
about 1,700 antiquities have been repatriated
since 2012.  To date, the
current government has brought back 539 artifacts
from different ancient regions
throughout the country and different periods
associated with Colombia's historical periods,
most of the country's archaeological archives.
Colombia is home to amazing pieces from
different periods and cultures dating back
6,000 to 7,000 years. The repatriated objects
originated from
private collectors of America, Spain, Germany, and
Mexico.  China's
